definition[0]: one of the eight smallest and least valuable pieces which each player has in the game of chess
definition[1]: someone who is used by a more powerful person or group and has no control of the situation
example[0]: They became pawns in the political battle.
definition[2]: to leave something valuable with a pawnbroker in order to borrow money from them
definition[3]: to leave a valuable item with a pawnbroker in order to borrow money from them. If the person borrowing the money does not pay it back, the pawnbroker can sell the item to get back the debt, and any interest that is owed
example[1]: As credit has gotten tighter for many people, the number willing to pawn their cars has increased.
definition[4]: if an item is in pawn, it has been left with a pawnbroker in order to borrow money from them
definition[5]: if you take an item out of pawn, you pay back the money you have borrowed and get the item back from the pawnbroker
